SEARCH
Package algorithms.imageProcessing.features.mser

Class Canonicalizer

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.features.mser.Canonicalizer
public class Canonicalizer extends Object
class to produce descriptors for MSER, usable for matching same objects in other images.
Author:
nichole

  • Method Details

    • canonicalizeRegions

      public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions(List<Region> regions, GreyscaleImage meanWindowedImg)
      NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1);
      Parameters:
      regions -
      meanWindowedImg -
      Returns:

    • canonicalizeRegions4

      public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions4(gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.RegionPoints> regions, int imageWidth, int imageHeight)
      uses RegionPoints.hogOrientations to make multiple cRegions for each RegionPoints instance. it also make a region for the mser ellipse derived orientation.
      Parameters:
      regions -
      Returns:

    • canonicalizeRegions

      public List<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions(int w0, int h0, Canonicalizer.RegionPoints regionPoints)
      NOTE: the returned CRegions need to have their .dataIdx fields set for their specific context.
      Parameters:
      regionPoints -
      Returns:

    • canonicalizeRegions4

      public Set<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions4(Canonicalizer.RegionPoints r, int imageWidth, int imageHeight)
      uses RegionPoints.hogOrientations to make multiple cRegions for each RegionPoints instance. it also make a region for the mser ellipse derived orientation. NOTE" remember to set cRegion.dataIdx = rIdx in the results afterwards.
      Returns:

    • canonicalizeRegions3

      public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions3(gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.RegionPoints> regions, GreyscaleImage img)
      NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1);
      Returns:

    • canonicalizeRegions2

      NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1);
      Returns:

      NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1);

    • canonicalizeRegion

      public Canonicalizer.CRegion canonicalizeRegion(Region r, int imageWidth, int imageHeight)
      NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1); NOTE the field utocorrelation is not clculated here and my be removed.
      Returns:

    • calculateEllipseParams

      public static Canonicalizer.RegionGeometry calculateEllipseParams(Region r, int imageWidth, int imageHeight)

    • canonicalizeRegions

      public List<gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion>> canonicalizeRegions(List<Region> regions, List<GreyscaleImage> pyramidImgs)
      create canonicalized regions containing coordinate maps that can be used to make descriptors. Note that for best results, the pyramidImgs should have been pre-processed so that a pixel contains the mean of itself and its neighboring pixels.
      Parameters:
      regions -
      pyramidImgs -
      Returns:
